description: Borrowed from French pertinent, from Latin pertinens, present participle of pertinere (“to extend, stretch out, belong, relate, pertain, have concern”), from per (“through”) + tenere (“to hold”).

adjectives.description: pertinent (comparative more pertinent, superlative most pertinent)

entries.meaning: Important with regard to (a subject or matter); pertaining; relevant.
(law) A right that attaches to land, in Scots law.
